revised_title: Anatomy and Development of the Wing in the Common Fowl
tldr: The author examines the structure and development of the wing in the common fowl, focusing on the carpus and its elements. The study reveals that the two persistent carpals in the bird's wing, the intermedio-radiale and centralo-ulnare, are compound structures containing remnants of an intermedium and a centrale. The research also provides insights into the development of the metacarpal bones and the distal phalanges in the fowl.
